alert.note: Alert for Grant (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 04 at 1:53PM CST until January 05 at 6:00PM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM WEDNESDAY TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM WEDNESDAY TO 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Grant County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 PM Wednesday to 11 AM MST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 8 AM Wednesday to 5 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 2 AM to 5 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Call Nebraska 511 for the latest road information.
